meanings.definition: Able to be relied on as honest or truthful.
meanings.sent1: My best friend is very trustworthy and always keeps my secrets.
meanings.sent2: It is important to find a trustworthy mechanic who won't overcharge you.
meanings.sent3: I asked the magic eight ball if it was trustworthy, and it replied 'Outlook not so good.'
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse stood tall and trustworthy, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent5: The trustworthy dog led the lost child back to their family.

meanings.sent1: The kind teacher was always trustworthy and helped her students whenever they needed it.
meanings.sent2: A trustworthy employee is someone who always completes their tasks on time.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked at the acorn with a trustworthy expression, as if promising to guard it with its life.
meanings.sent4: The trustworthy oak tree provided shade and shelter to all the animals in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The trustworthy weather forecast predicted a sunny day for the picnic.
